i want to make a archive like archive manager does
in this case, the screen
you probably want to do      tar -xvzf outputfile.tgz inputfile
doh!@
you probably want to do      tar -cvzf outputfile.tgz inputfile
see, the -f option tells it to write the end result to a file....without it, it just spews into the screen (stdout)
tanks
however, you can redirect stdout to a file as well, or to another program....like this:    tar -czv inputfile >> outputfile.tgz

the >> takes the stdout and appends it to the end of a file (creating it if nonexistant). you can use > instead of >> to start at the beginning of the file instead of appending, overwriting anything that's there. and you can use | to send it to std input on another program
